availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Owen Dorsey (Oldham County, Kentucky, merchant and provisional government convention member)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, merchant and provisional government convention member. Maryland native. Married to Mildred Caldwell Dorsey in Oldham County, Kentucky, on March 16, 1852. Father of Sallie Dorsey, Henry Dorsey, and James Dorsey. Postmaster of Beard's Station, Oldham County in 1857. Merchant in Oldham County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Merchant in Oldham County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Dallas County, Dallas, p. 45B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film #000482449, p.291.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p.700, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Oldham County, KY, August 1863, p. 59, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
KYR-0004-033-0001.
